soot.jimple.infoflow.android

Class InfoflowAndroidConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.jimple.infoflow.InfoflowConfiguration
      • soot.jimple.infoflow.android.InfoflowAndroidConfiguration

  • public class InfoflowAndroidConfiguration
extends soot.jimple.infoflow.InfoflowConfiguration
    Configuration class for the Android-specific data flow analysis
    Author:
    Steven Arzt

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.AnalysisFileConfiguration
      The configuration for the various files required for the data flow analysis
      static class  InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.CallbackAnalyzer
      Enumeration containing the supported callback analyzers
      static class  InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.CallbackConfiguration
      The configuration for analyzing callbacks in Android apps
      static class  InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.CallbackSourceMode
      Methods for deciding whether a parameter of a system callback is to be treated as a source or not
      static class  InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.CategoryMode
      The modes (included or excludes) that a category can have for the data flow analysis
      static class  InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.IccConfiguration
      The configuration for the inter-component data flow analysis
      static class  InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.LayoutMatchingMode
      Possible modes for matching layout components as data flow sources
      static class  InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.SootIntegrationMode
      Enumeration containing the different ways in which Soot can be used
      static class  InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.SourceSinkConfiguration
      The configuration for the source and sink manager
      static class  InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.SourceSinkFilterMode
      The default mode how the filter shall treat source or sink categories that have not been configured explicitly

        Sets whether FlowDroid shall analyze one component at a time instead of generating one big dummy main method containing all components

      • setSootIntegrationMode

        public void setSootIntegrationMode(InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.SootIntegrationMode sootIntegrationMode)
        Sets how FloweDroid shall interact with the underlying Soot instance. FlowDroid can either set up Soot on its own, or work with an existing instance.
        Parameters:
        sootIntegrationMode - The integration mode that FlowDroid shall use

      • getSootIntegrationMode

        public InfoflowAndroidConfiguration.SootIntegrationMode getSootIntegrationMode()
        Gets how FloweDroid shall interact with the underlying Soot instance. FlowDroid can either set up Soot on its own, or work with an existing instance.
        Returns:
        The integration mode that FlowDroid shall use
